title: [BUG] MAUI: SKCanvasView crash, unable to display SKBitmap directly

comments.author: koszeggy
comments.body: Update: I opened a [discussion](https://github.com/dotnet/maui/discussions/8490) in the dotnet/maui repo. Attempts 3 and 4 seem to be at their side but I'm not 100% sure where the boundaries are.

comments.author: cangunaydin
comments.body:
Hi,
I am also trying to run a simple sample with skiasharp and maui. I am having the same problem that you described in your first attempt on my project. And to make it crash, inserting the skiacanvas object to xaml is enough.
<skia:SKCanvasView x:Name="skiaView" />

So i was wondering, am i doing sth wrong with installation or officially skiasharp doesn't work with maui?

comments.author: timctrahan
comments.body: I am having this same sequence of issues myself.  After weeks of coding a graphics library to generate the images I want displayed on my maui page, I have hit a brick wall trying to get this last part to work.  I generate an SkBitmap and get the same crash when trying to use SkCanvasView and when trying to use the Maui Graphics view, I haven't been able to figure out how to render my skbitmap. trying with graphicsview says toplatformimage not supported.  This is very frustrating

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
Duplicate of #2013

The issue is there is no way for SkiaSharp to register handlers dynamically: https://github.com/dotnet/maui/issues/7258

Upvote that issue to get this working magically.
